abstract: Francis X Clines Editorial Observer examines financial plight of Atlantic City, where four of city's 12 casinos have closed, leaving thousands from gambling industry unemployed and without insurance; notes the Trump Taj Mahal is likely to be the next to disappear; maintains city's downfall casts a bitter hue on the euphoria of 1976, when New Jersey first voted to legalize casinos.
lead_paragraph: The once-thriving casinos continue a long, painful slide from the glory days of the 1970s. The Trump Taj Mahal may be the next to close.

headline.main: The Incredible Shrinking Action in Atlantic City
headline.print_headline: The Incredible Shrinking Action in Atlantic City

snippet: The once-thriving casinos continue a long, painful slide from the glory days of the 1970s. The Trump Taj Mahal may be the next to close....
